title: 2 Quick Ways Connect a Kindle Fire Tablet to Your TV

steps.title: Turn on a Miracast-enabled device.
steps.content: Turn on a Miracast-enabled device. Most modern TVs and monitors support Miracast. If you're unsure, consult your device's manual or look for the logo in the settings menu. This method will work on Kindle Fire tablets with FOS 8 and higher. Be sure to update your Kindle . If your TV doesn't have Miracast, you can purchase an HDMI display dongle and connect it to your TV. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Connect your device and Kindle Fire to the same Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect your device and Kindle Fire to the same Wi-Fi network . This is what allows your devices to connect wirelessly.

steps.title: Swipe down on the top of your Kindle Fire.
steps.content: Swipe down on the top of your Kindle Fire . This will open the Quick Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Screen Mirroring.
steps.content: Tap Screen Mirroring . You can also find this option in your regular settings. Tap Connected Devices > Screen Mirroring . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your Miracast-enabled device.
steps.content: Tap your Miracast-enabled device. It may take a few moments to connect. Once connected, you'll see your Kindle Fire screen on your TV. To stop Screen Mirroring, swipe down on the top of your Kindle Fire to open the menu again. Tap Screen Mirroring to turn it off.

steps.title: Purchase the correct HDMI adapter.
steps.content: Purchase the correct HDMI adapter. For older Fire models, such as: HD Kids, HDX 8.9, HD7, HD10, HD8, and HD6, you'll need a micro-HDMI port to HDMI adapter. This adapter can be purchased online or at a Kindle Fire retailer. This method will not work on newer Kindle Fires.

steps.title: Attach the HDMI adapter to your Kindle Fire.
steps.content: Attach the HDMI adapter to your Kindle Fire. Locate the micro USB connector of your HDMI adapter and connect it to your Kindle Fire. It will be the smaller end of the HDMI adapter and will only fit into the micro USB slot of your Kindle Fire.

steps.title: Connect an HDMI cable to the adapter and your TV.
steps.content: Connect an HDMI cable to the adapter and your TV. One end of the HDMI adapter will go into the adapter, while the other end will go into the port on the back of your TV. it. The Kindle Fire screen should appear on your TV screen. If it doesn't, use the TV remote to check each input source.
